metadata.name: base_chatt_police_police_incidents
metadata.comment:
### police_incidents
This is a clean view of a table that contains data on police incidents reported in Chattanooga, Tennessee. The dataset is sourced from [Chattanooga Open Data Portal](https://www.chattadata.org/Public-Safety/Police-Incidents/jvkg-79ss) and includes detailed information about incidents involving police officers.
#### Key Insights:
This table can be used to analyze trends in public safety, including patterns in crime locations, types of offenses, and the volume of incidents over time. It may be particularly useful for visualizing geographic crime data or identifying areas with a high frequency of police incidents.

address.name: address
address.comment: The street address where the incident occurred.

city.name: city
city.comment: The city where the incident occurred (typically Chattanooga).

state.name: state
state.comment: The state where the incident occurred (typically Tennessee).

zip.name: zip
zip.comment: The postal code of the incident location.

date_incident.name: date_incident
date_incident.comment: The date when the incident occurred.

jurisdiction.name: jurisdiction
jurisdiction.comment: The legal or geographic area where the incident was reported, indicating the responsible law enforcement entity.

incident_tract.name: incident_tract
incident_tract.comment: The census tract where the incident occurred, used for demographic analysis.

zone.name: zone
zone.comment: The police zone where the incident took place.

ucr_incident_code.name: ucr_incident_code
ucr_incident_code.comment: The Uniform Crime Reporting (UCR) code associated with the type of incident.

incident_description.name: incident_description
incident_description.comment: A brief description of the offense or event that led to the police involvement.

incident_type.name: incident_type
incident_type.comment: The type of incident (e.g., property crime, violent crime, traffic-related).

case_number.name: case_number
case_number.comment: A unique identifier for the case or incident.

case_status.name: case_status
case_status.comment: The current status of the case (e.g., open, closed, under investigation).

case_status_description.name: case_status_description
case_status_description.comment: A more detailed description of the case status.

latitude.name: latitude
latitude.comment: The geographical latitude of the incident location.

longitude.name: longitude
longitude.comment: The geographical longitude of the incident location.

citydst.name: citydst
citydst.comment: The city district where the incident occurred.

neighborhood.name: neighborhood
neighborhood.comment: The neighborhood where the incident took place.

has_stats.label: Has Stats?
has_stats.description: Indicates whether there are statistics for this table

metadata.name: base_src_chattadata_311_service_requests
metadata.comment: This model processes and casts service request data fields from  src_chattadata_311_service_requests to appropriate data types from the original source data.

service_request_key.name: service_request_key
service_request_key.comment: Unique identifier of the service request in the Accela system.

created_date.name: created_date
created_date.comment: Date the service request was created.

on_time_indicator.name: on_time_indicator
on_time_indicator.comment: Indicator if the request is completed at or before the due date.

department.name: department
department.comment: Department the service request is routed to.

request_type.name: request_type
request_type.comment: The type of the service request created.

description.name: description
description.comment: Description of the service request often populated by the constituent submitting the request.

request_type_code.name: request_type_code
request_type_code.comment: Urgency of the request (e.g., Urgent, Emergency, Standard, None).

status_code.name: status_code
status_code.comment: Status of the request, such as Open, New, or Closed.

actual_days_to_complete_working.name: actual_days_to_complete_working
actual_days_to_complete_working.comment: Actual number of working days taken to complete the request.

sla_fy_2019.name: sla_fy_2019
sla_fy_2019.comment: SLA (Service Level Agreement) for the fiscal year 2019.

ispublic.name: ispublic
ispublic.comment: Indicates if the service request is public.

citydst.name: citydst
citydst.comment: Council district in which the request was submitted.

publiclocation.name: publiclocation
publiclocation.comment: Geographic location associated with the public request.

transmit_timestamp.name: transmit_timestamp
transmit_timestamp.comment: Timestamp indicating when the data was transmitted.

has_stats.label: Has Stats?
has_stats.description: Indicates whether there are statistics for this table

metadata.name: fct_chatt_police_police_incidents_dashboard
metadata.comment: This model is designed for the Chattanooga, Tennessee Police Incidents Dashboard. It provides a clean, summarized view of police incidents in Chattanooga, including key information such as the address, case number, date, description, and geolocation of incidents.

address.name: address
address.comment: The address where the incident occurred.

case_number.name: case_number
case_number.comment: A unique identifier for the police incident.

date_incident.name: date_incident
date_incident.comment: The date and time when the incident occurred.

incident_description.name: incident_description
incident_description.comment: A brief description of the incident type.

latitude.name: latitude
latitude.comment: The latitude coordinate of the incident location.

longitude.name: longitude
longitude.comment: The longitude coordinate of the incident location.

zip.name: zip
zip.comment: The zip code where the incident took place.

has_stats.label: Has Stats?
has_stats.description: Indicates whether there are statistics for this table
